clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of ATRA in the Treatment of ITP
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of All-trans Retinoic Acid in the Treatment of Immune Thrombocytopenia

collaborator.agency: The Sixth Medical Center of PLA General Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: An open-label, multicenter study to compare the efficacy and safety of ATRA for the treatment of adults with primary immune thrombocytopenia (ITP)

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators are undertaking an open-label, single-arm, multicenter trial of adults patients with ITP in China. Patients with treatmant naive ITP were given ATRA treatment. Platelet count, bleeding and other symptoms were evaluated before and after treatment. Adverse events are also recorded throughout the study.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: ATRA is used to treat ITP patients.

primary_outcome.description: The maintenance of platelet count ≥ 30 x 10^9/L, at least 2-fold increase of the baseline count, the absence of bleeding, and no need for rescue medication at the 6-month follow-up

secondary_outcome.description: complete response (CR) was defined as platelet count more than 100,000 per cubic millimeter and absence of bleeding.
Response (R) as platelet count more than 30,000 per cubic millimeter and at least 2-fold increase of the baseline count and absence of bleeding.
Number of patients with bleeding complication ( WHO bleeding score).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with adverse events
The time from starting treatment to time of achievement of CR or R
Duration of response at 6-month follow up.
Platelet counts below 100 x 109/L or bleeding (from CR) or platelet counts below 30 x 109/L, less than 2-fold increase of baseline platelet count or bleeding (from R)

arm_group.description: ATRA is given at a daily dose of 10 mg twice daily orally for 12 weeks

intervention.description: ATRA is given concomitantly at a daily dose of 10 mg twice daily orally for 12 weeks

overall_official.affiliation: Peking University People's Hospital, Peking University Insititute of Hematology

responsible_party.investigator_title: Vice president of Peking Univeristy Institute of Hematology
